room_types: A room with no floor, only horizon
A chamber echoing nothing back
A space that stretches as you walk
A cliff's edge with no bottom in sight
A library of blank books
ambient_details: The silence bends your thoughts inward.
You feel your name fading at the edges.
Time stops counting here.
The walls pulse like lungs, but do not breathe.
There is no echo when you speak.

room_types: A childhood bedroom, unchanged and dusty
A hallway lined with faces that know your name
A clock tower where each tick is a scream
A photo gallery where frames blink
A kitchen that smells like your favorite meal
ambient_details: You hear laughter from long ago, faint but clear.
A breeze carries forgotten names.
Each step feels heavier, like retracing grief.
Objects here resist your touch.
Something old inside you stirs.

room_types: A corridor that folds into itself
A garden where stars grow on vines
A room that changes every time you look away
A stairwell spiraling into a waterfall
A sky filled with floating furniture
ambient_details: Gravity feels like a suggestion.
The ceiling sings softly to itself.
Shapes flicker between familiar and unknown.
You taste color and feel sound.
Everything is real, and nothing is.

core_concepts: Self-awareness to the point of disintegration
room_types: A room of perfect mirrors, but no reflection
A corridor where your doppelgänger walks beside you
A lake that mimics your thoughts aloud
A stage with a spotlight but no audience
An empty gallery titled 'You'
ambient_details: You are being watched — by yourself.
Your words come back in another voice.
The floor reflects your past, not your present.
The room breathes in sync with your fear.
You cannot blink until your reflection does.

room_types: A hallway of locked doors, never the same twice
A theater showing your worst memories acted by strangers
A mirror maze where your shadow moves differently
A library of names you've forgotten
A cellar lit by your heartbeat
ambient_details: The darkness leans closer when you breathe.
Your shadow whispers things you almost understand.
There is a heartbeat that isn’t yours.
You smell smoke, but there is no fire.
Your past self is standing just out of view.
